result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle L. Porodish

records.addlTxt:
3:03 PM Defendant Kyle L. Porodish appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Gregory McCann appeared by video for Kyle L. Porodish.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline 12-02-2022
Further proceedings scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:29 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on December 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kyle L. Porodish appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Gregory McCann appeared by video for Kyle L. Porodish.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing set for 10-26-2022 at  3:00pm

NOT ON THE RECORD - Defendant Kyle L. Porodish appeared by video, from a hospital in Milwaukee.  Attorney James Gregory McCann appeared by video for Kyle L. Porodish.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will be hospitalized for several weeks.  Court adjourns this matter to 10-17-22 at 1:30 pm Br. 1.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:37 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle L. Porodish appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail. Attorney Luke Harrison appearing in court with the defendant.  More time is requested to appoint counsel in this matter.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess fentanyl.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-08-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
